ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.User

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Elastic.ElasticStorable
      • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.User.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoggedInUser

    public class User
extends ElasticStorable
implements Observable
    Abstract class representing a user of the app. This class is implemented in the app by LoggedInUser, who represents the current user of the app on a particular device. This class mainly acts as a container for all of the various classes that make up a user.

    In the system, a user has a list of Friends contained in a FriendsList, a TrackedFriendsList for their tracked friends, an Inventory which contains the Trinkets they own and want to be available for trading, a NotificationManager to notify them if another user wishes to trade with them, a TradeManager to handle their trades with their friends, and a user profile which stores and displays their information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User()
        Public constructor for user: initializes all attribute classes as empty classes with no active data. This constructor is mainly used for testing purposes as it implies that no information is available about the user, not even an email address. By default a new user needs to be saved to the network, so the needToSave attribute is set to true.

      • User

        public User(FriendsList friendsList,
    Inventory inventory,
    NotificationManager notificationManager,
    UserProfile profile,
    TrackedFriendsList trackedFriends,
    TradeManager tradeManager)
        A public constructor for User in the case where the user's details are known for all its attribute classes. This constructor would be called for a user already on the system, whose data can be pulled from Elastic Search or the phone's local data.
        Parameters:
        friendsList - - a FriendsList of the user's friends
        inventory - - the user's Inventory with their trinkets
        notificationManager - - a notification manager to notify the user if a new trade has been offered to them
        profile - - a profile storing their information
        trackedFriends - - a FriendsList which stores the Friends the user wishes to track
        tradeManager - - a TradeManager for handling the user's trades

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String email)
        Constructor that uses the email a user enters to register in the LoginActivity. This email is then used to initialize their TradeManager. All other user attributes are initialized as empty. This constructor is used when a new user logs in for the first time, as there is no information in the system about the user except the email they entered to register. By default a new user needs to be saved to the network, so the needToSave attribute is set to true.
        Parameters:
        email - - the user's email address. Taken from the email they enter into the LoginActivity

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged().

        Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).

        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable

      • getNeedToSave

        public java.lang.Boolean getNeedToSave()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the User with this contact information needs to be saved to the network. If the contact information of the user has been changed then needToSave is set to true and the user needs to be saved. Otherwise, this should return false indicating that the user does not need to be saved.
        Returns:
        Boolean - if true then the User with this contact information needs to be re-saved to the network, if false then there is nothing new that needs to be sav

      • setNeedToSave

        protected void setNeedToSave(java.lang.Boolean needToSave)
        Sets a boolean indicating if the User with this contact information needs to be saved to the network. If the contact information of the user has been changed then needToSave should be set to true meaning the user needs to be saved. Otherwise, this should be set to false indicating that the user does not need to be saved.

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns the tag section of the elastic search entry's URL. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. This method will return "User" as the tag for User. Implementation of the ElasticStorable method.
        Specified by:
        getTag in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        String - the tag used to generate the url for each type of item stored in elastic search

      • getResourceUrl

        public java.lang.String getResourceUrl()
        Returns the base URL each class of ElasticStorable object will be saved to. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. Each individual object is then stored with their own unique ids. The resource URL specifies the base URL which is composed of the server URL ("http://cmput301.softwareprocess.es:8080/cmput301f15t01/") followed by the tag of the particular class, "User" as the tag for User objects. Implementation of the ElasticStorable method.
        Specified by:
        getResourceUrl in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        String - base URL (no unique ID) for an object being stored to elastic search

      • getUid

        public java.lang.String getUid()
        * Returns a unique ID for each user's objects being stored to Elastic Search. This is appended to the resource url to save each object to the elastic search server. For a particular user of the system associated with a unique email address, this method will always return the same UID. Implementation of the ElasticStorable method.
        Specified by:
        getUid in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        - an id unique to each user of the system for saving objects to elastic search

                                               java.lang.Class<T> type)

      • getFromNetwork

        public <T extends ElasticStorable> void getFromNetwork(java.lang.Class<T> type)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to find this object on the elasticsearch server. If the object cannot be found then pushes the current version to the server. Each object is searched for using its know URL, which is composed of its resource url (getResourceUrl()) and an ID unique to the user associated with the object (getUid()). Implementation of the ElasticStorable method.
        Specified by:
        getFromNetwork in class ElasticStorable
        Type Parameters:
        T - - type may be of any class extending ElasticStorable
        Parameters:
        type - - class of the object being saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onGetResult

        public <T extends ElasticStorable> void onGetResult(T result)
        Method called after getFromNetwork gets a response. Implementation of the ElasticStorable method. When a User is retrieved from the network, a new User object is created and its attributes are set to the data returned by elastic search. This is used when a user with data existing on the server logs in again, so that their data and setting from previous uses of the system is restored.
        Specified by:
        onGetResult in class ElasticStorable
        Type Parameters:
        T - type passed to getFromNetwork
        Parameters:
        result - result of getFromNetwork, a User object

      • onSearchResult

        public <T extends ElasticStorable> void onSearchResult(java.util.Collection<T> result)
        Method called after searchOnNetwork gets a response. Implementation of the ElasticStorable method. Current app functionality does not require searching for users.
        Specified by:
        onSearchResult in class ElasticStorable
        Parameters:
        result - result of searchOnNetwork

      • setProfile

        public void setProfile(UserProfile profile)
        Sets user's UserProfile, which is an object containing the information about a user and settings for their account. This method is called after an existing user's data is pulled off the network, so that the user's existing details are repopulated. After setting this field then needToSave is set to true so that the change will be saved to the network.
        Parameters:
        profile -

        Sets user's TrackedFriendsList. This method is called after an existing user's data is pulled off the network, so that the user's existing details are repopulated. After setting this field then needToSave is set to true so that the change will be saved to the network. The list may be empty. \ *
        Parameters:
        trackedFriendsList - - an user's TrackedFriendsList

        Returns:
        TrackedFriendsList - an user's TrackedFriendsList

        public FriendsList getFriendsList()

      • setFriendsList

        public void setFriendsList(FriendsList friendsList)
        Sets User's FriendsList. This method is called after an existing user's data is pulled off the network, so that the user's existing details are repopulated. After setting this field then needToSave is set to true so that the change will be saved to the network. The list may be empty.
        Parameters:
        friendsList - - a user's FriendsList

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
        Returns user's Inventory. This method is used to populate the trinkets displayed in the InventoryActivity. The Inventory may be empty.
        Returns:
        Inventory - a list of the Trinkets a user has added to their account

      • setInventory

        Parameters:
        inventory - - a list of the Trinkets a user has added to their account

      • getTradeManager

        public TradeManager getTradeManager()
        Returns user's TradeManager. This method is used to get the TradeManager object that manages the trades a user is engaged in with other users, and the records of the user's previous trades.

        TradeManager

      • getSearchUrl

        public java.lang.String getSearchUrl()
        Returns the base URL each class of ElasticStorable object can be searched on the server with. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. Each individual object is then stored with their own unique ids. The search URL specifies the base URL which is composed of the server URL ("http://cmput301.softwareprocess.es:8080/cmput301f15t01/") followed by the tag of the particular class, "User" as the tag for User objects, and then followed by "/_search/".
        Specified by:
        getSearchUrl in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        - url for searching Users on elastic search

      • getDefaultLocation

        public android.location.Location getDefaultLocation()
        Returns the default location specifying where a trinket is located. The location is expressed as a latitude/longitude pair. This attribute will allow other users to see if it will be convenient for them to collect a trinket if they choose to trade for it. By default the default location is the phone's location as returned by the phone's GPS, but the user may set it to another value.
        Returns:
        Location - the location that a Trinket's location will be set to by default.

      • setDefaultLocation

        public void setDefaultLocation(android.location.Location defaultLocation)
        Sets the default location specifying where a trinket is located. The location is expressed as a latitude/longitude pair. This attribute will allow other users to see if it will be convenient for them to collect a trinket if they choose to trade for it. By default the default location is the phone's location as returned by the phone's GPS, but the user may set it to another value.
        Parameters:
        defaultLocation - - the location that a Trinket's location will be set to by default.

      • setEmail

        public void setEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Sets the user's email address. The user's email address is how they are identified in the app and how other users will be able to search for and interact with them. It is also used to email confirmation of completed trades to the users involved in the trade. At minimum, all users must have an email address attached to them. After setting this field then needToSave is set to true so that the change will be saved to the network. This method will be used when the user enters their email in the LoginActivity and logs in for the first time.
        Parameters:
        email - - the user's email address they enter to log in

                    throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
